result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan Bart Frakes

Defendant Ryan Bart Frakes not in court, in custody.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Ryan Bart Frakes.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Case scheduled for plea/sentencing hearing. Defendant not produced by Waukesha County. Case adjourned for status conference by Zoom, Branch 15.
Status conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court, defendant Ryan Bart Frakes not in court, in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means.
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case heard by ZOOM.
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.
Case in court for status conference. Defense requests resolution date. Case adjourned to Branch 15.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court, defendant Ryan Bart Frakes not in court, in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Status Conference. 
Defense advises the court defendant has pending matter forthcoming and request an adjournment. ... 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Parties advised this hearing will be held Remotely-via zoom.  Status conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court, defendant Ryan Bart Frakes not in court, in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST.
Case in court for a Status Conference. 
Defense advises the court he has recently received a global offer from the State and needs additional time to review offer with client.  
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Parties advised this hearing will be held Remotely-via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court, defendant Ryan Bart Frakes not in court, in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for Calendar Call. DEFENDANT'S APPEARANCE WAIVED. Court canceled stayed bench warrant. 
Discussion held to determine the posture of the case. Defense counsel in receipt of discovery but no offer and request an adjournment. 
Court ordered this case adjourned back to Branch 19.

The next hearing will be held IN PERSON.  Status conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State advises the court the defendant has a VOP hold. Court orders matter adjourned to give defense counsel time to locate defendant.  Calendar call scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with Pick 'n Save at 6969 N Port Washington Road, Glendale; JWR
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Ryan Bart Frakes in court with attorney Evan Barrett Weitz.  Defendant Ryan Bart Frakes in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ryan Bart Frakes appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant has lower number case(s) pending.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Br. 19 for pretrial.  
This hearing will be streamed Live through DACAST: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/21a87aec-ffb6-5325-fb81-55812563aa79  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
